subject: RE: [junit] Re: How does Unit test in a heirarchy works...
msgSnippet: ... Yes. ... I think the most commonly used pattern is Abstract Testcase, where you use Factory Methods to parametrize the tests. Cheers, Ilja
messageBody:
junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> - Sharing utility methods that are not tests.

Yes.

> - Sharing tests that provide the same functionalities but
> initialized with different parameters depending on which
> subclass they are in. In TestNG, this is obtained either by
> passing different parameters to my test methods or having
> TestNG invoke specific constructors with values configured in
> testng.xml. I believe you can reach a similar result with a
> TestDecorator in JUnit.

I think the most commonly used pattern is Abstract Testcase, where you use
Factory Methods to parametrize the tests.

Cheers, Ilja
